entity5.name: Red Dead Redemption
entity5.description: An action-adventure open world video game set in the dying days of the Wild West era at the turn of the 20th century.

entity6.name: Fortnite
entity6.description: A popular online video game that features battle royale gameplay, where players fight to be the last one standing on an ever-shrinking map.

entity9.description: A form of video gaming that involves the use of specialized electronic devices connected to a television or other display, designed for playing video games at home.

entity13.name: computer scientists and engineers
entity13.description: Experts who work on the design, development, and application of computer systems and technologies, often contributing to advancements in various fields including gaming.

entity14.name: Spacewar!
entity14.description: One of the earliest video games, developed in 1962 at MIT.

entity15.name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
entity15.description: A prestigious university located in Massachusetts, known for its contributions to science and technology.

entity18.name: Pac-Man
entity18.description: An iconic maze chase video game featuring the character Pac-Man eating dots while avoiding ghosts.

entity20.name: Atari 2600
entity20.description: One of the first successful home video game consoles, released by Atari Inc. in 1977.

entity21.name: The 1980s
entity21.description: A decade in the late 20th century, known for significant cultural and technological developments.

entity23.name: Super Mario Bros.
entity23.description: A side-scrolling platformer developed by Nintendo, featuring the character Mario rescuing Princess Toadstool from Bowser.

entity24.name: The Legend of Zelda
entity24.description: An action-adventure game developed and published by Nintendo, centered around the hero Link on a quest to save Princess Zelda and Hyrule from the antagonist Ganon.

entity25.name: Tetris
entity25.description: A puzzle video game created by Alexey Pajitnov, where players manipulate falling blocks to create complete horizontal lines without gaps.

entity26.name: 8-bit and 16-bit graphics
entity26.description: A type of computer graphics that uses 8 or 16 bits to represent each pixel, allowing for a limited but more detailed and colorful display compared to earlier systems.

entity27.name: 3D graphics
entity27.description: A technology used in computer graphics to create three-dimensional visual representations.

entity28.name: CD-ROM technology
entity28.description: A data storage medium that uses optical discs for storing and retrieving digital information.

entity29.name: Doom
entity29.description: A first-person shooter video game developed by id Software, released in 1993, known for popularizing the genre and its innovative 3D graphics.

entity30.name: Quake
entity30.description: A first-person shooter video game developed by id Software, released in 1996, known for its advanced 3D graphics and multiplayer capabilities.

entity31.name: Final Fantasy VII
entity31.description: A role-playing video game developed by Square (now Square Enix), released in 1997, known for its significant impact on the RPG genre and its use of CD-ROM technology.

entity33.name: StarCraft
entity33.description: A real-time strategy game developed by Blizzard Entertainment, known for its deep storyline and competitive multiplayer mode.

entity34.name: Half-Life
entity34.description: A first-person shooter game developed by Valve Corporation, renowned for its immersive story and innovative gameplay mechanics.

entity35.name: Diablo
entity35.description: An action role-playing game series created by Blizzard Entertainment, featuring dark fantasy settings and dungeon crawling elements.

entity36.name: Xbox Live
entity36.description: An online gaming service provided by Microsoft for the Xbox family of video game consoles.

entity37.name: PlayStation Network
entity37.description: A digital media and online multiplayer service created by Sony Interactive Entertainment, primarily used with PlayStation gaming consoles.

entity38.name: World of Warcraft
entity38.description: A massively multiplayer online role-playing game (MMORPG) developed by Blizzard Entertainment.

entity39.name: Halo
entity39.description: A series of first-person shooter video games, primarily developed by 343 Industries and previously Bungie Studios.

entity40.name: Call of Duty
entity40.description: A series of first-person shooter video games, primarily developed by various studios including Infinity Ward and Treyarch.

entity42.name: virtual reality (VR)
entity42.description: A computer-generated environment or simulation that allows a user to interact with a 3D world using special electronic equipment such as a headset.

entity43.name: augmented reality (AR)
entity43.description: A technology that superimposes information and images onto the real world, enhancing the user's perception of their surroundings through digital elements.

entity44.name: cloud gaming
entity44.description: A model of online gaming where the game is stored on a server and streamed to the player’s device, allowing for gameplay without downloading or installing software.

entity45.name: Oculus Rift
entity45.description: A virtual reality headset developed by Oculus VR, now part of Facebook Technologies.

entity46.name: PlayStation VR
entity46.description: A virtual reality headset designed for use with the PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 consoles.

entity47.description: An augmented reality mobile game developed by Niantic, where players can catch Pokémon in real-world locations.

entity49.name: artificial intelligence
entity49.description: The simulation of human intelligence processes by machines, especially computer systems.;;;A subset of artificial intelligence that involves algorithms improving through data and experience without being explicitly programmed.

entity51.name: blockchain technology
entity51.description: A decentralized digital ledger that records transactions across multiple computers in such a way as to allow for secure, transparent, and tamper-proof record-keeping.
